text: can you elaborate on the story that BBC
is now running with that the management
has complained to un and yourself
directly about the harassment of BBC
Persian service journalists and going
after families arrests confiscation and
of property and what can you possibly do
following this complaint so we did hear
from from the BBC about and we've known
about this for some time but we had a
formal complaint in which exactly as you
say the restrictions on on individuals
associated with the BBC so not just the
BBC Persian service employees but their
families as well have been under
significant pressure over the last it
seems like last six to nine months
perhaps even longer for the content of
their work which is journalism so so we
have raised our concerns in turn as we
do the way it works is we we will
communicate directly with the government
and we'll say something to the effect
that you know without prejudice to the
the truth of these allegations if
they're true were very concerned and we
raise very serious concerns with the
government just over the last couple of
days we urge the government of Iran to
to stop harassing the employees and the
families of employees of the BBC Persian
service as well as other journalists and
and I would say it's a very very serious
concern to us in part because it's
reflective of an overall pattern but
also because it's it's creating direct
harm against individuals who are only
trying to do their job which is a job
that is protected by international human
rights law
you
